metadata.title: How to Use YouTube Community Tab 2025: Complete Strategy Guide
metadata.description: Master YouTube's Community Tab. Post types, engagement strategies, and growth tactics.

hero.headline: How to Use YouTube Community Tab
hero.subheadline: Keep your audience engaged between uploads. Maximize this powerful feature.

sections.content: The Community Tab is YouTube's social media feed—built right into the platform. It keeps subscribers engaged between videos, polls their preferences, and teases upcoming content. Many creators underuse this feature. Here's how to leverage it for growth and engagement.

content.title: Polls
content.description: Ask audience preferences. Content ideas. Incredible engagement rates.

content.title: Video Teasers
content.description: Promote uploads. Share clips. Cross-promote older content.

sections.title: Community Tab Strategy
content: Tease upcoming videos to build anticipation
Ask questions to learn audience preferences
Resurface older videos with new context

content.title: This or That Polls
content.description: 'Which should I make next?' Easy engagement, content ideas.

content.title: Thumbnail Reveal
content.description: Show upcoming video thumbnail. Build anticipation.

content.title: Question Posts
content.description: 'What's your biggest struggle with X?' Content research.

faq.question: When do I get the Community Tab?
faq.answer: Currently at 500 subscribers. YouTube has changed this threshold before. Once unlocked, it's permanent.

faq.question: Best time to post on Community Tab?
faq.answer: When your audience is active—check YouTube Analytics for audience times. Generally evening/night in your main audience's timezone.

faq.question: Do Community posts help video performance?
faq.answer: Indirectly yes. Engagement keeps you visible to subscribers. Posts can drive traffic to new uploads. Algorithm notices active creators.

faq.question: How often is too often?
faq.answer: Multiple times daily might annoy. 1-4 times per week is sweet spot. Quality over quantity—make posts genuinely interesting.
